name: General Waterproofing
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application
Ensure "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust.
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer - Add photos & have signed by Aland
Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Primer to all surfaces at a rate of 3-4m2/Ltr -Alternative primers - at a rate of 5-8 m2/Ltr
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
All corners, joints, gaps and cracks to be treated with a flexible polyurethane sealant HydraFlex.
Apply selected Membrane as per datasheet and application guidelines
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
First coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per Australian Standard

Note - a total dry film thickness of min 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of min 0.75mm (750 microns) per coat is required - Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 - 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
Allow the membrane coat to dry min 12 hours check the tackiness before applying next coat
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to second coat

Second coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per POLYBIT recommendations: Note - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of 0.75mm per coat is required - Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 - 1 Ltr / m2 per coat

Note - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of 0.75mm per coat is required - Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 - 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
The membrane is to be applied in a minimum of 2 coats at a total coverage of 1.2 to 2 litres per m². or relevant product TDS
Allow 2nd coat of Membrane min. 12 hours BUT no longer than 24 hours before installing top coat.
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to final coat
Apply final coat of top coat at a coverage rate of 3 - 4 m2/ltr
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument and record thickness reading
Ensure all work is completed as per ITP
Bathroom & Laundry
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application
Ensure "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust.
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer
Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Primer (Polyprime on floors, HYDRAPOXY on walls, PVC primer on pvc)
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
Shower & door angle in correct position and level. Angles to be 1.6mm gauge aluminium
All corners have polyurethane bond breaker (Hydraflex) installed with min 12mm radios
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
Apply first coat of membrane (HydraGuard)
Waterproof walls of shower and vanity section up to 1.8m/ceiling. Seal taps and the like. 2x coats required.
Min 150mm kicker has been waterproofed
Min 50mm past shower screen has been waterproofed
Apply final coat of membrane (HydraGuard)
Allow curing in accordance with manufacturers specification 24-48 hours min
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats.
Flood testing completed
Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test & rectification works completed
Ensure all work is completed as per ITP
Balcony & Podium
Area barricaded off to allow no access to balconies with signs posted/ visible to include date of application. "No access Waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust.
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer
Hold Point do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Primer (Polyprime) to all surfaces at Polybit recommendations. Alternative primers Hydrapoxy
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
All corners, joints, gaps and cracks to be treated with a flexible polyurethane sealant Hydraflex
Apply selected Membrane as per datasheet and application guidelines. Ensure sealant has fully cured before installing membrane.
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
First coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per POLYBIT recommendations

Note - a total dry film thickness of min 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of min 0.75mm (750 microns) per coat is required - Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 - 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
Allow the membrane coat to dry min 12 hours check the tackiness before applying next coat
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to second coat
Second coat of selected Membrane to entire areas as per POLYBIT recommendations

Note - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats. As such at min. Wet Film Thickness of 0.75mm per coat is required - Apply membrane at a coverage of 0.75 - 1 Ltr / m2 per coat
The membrane is to be applied in a minimum of 2 coats at a total coverage of 1.2 to 2 litres per m². or relevant product TDS
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to final coat
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument
Rectification of defective works for failure of flood test & rectification works completed
Ensure all work is completed as per ITP
Roof & Awnings
Area barricaded off to allow no access to roofs with signs posted/ visible to include date of application
Ensure "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust.
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer - have signed by Aland - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Primer (Polyprime or Hydrapoxy)
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations (PVC prime & Metal prime)
All corners have polyurethane bond breaker (hydraflex) installed with min 12mm radios
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
Apply first coat of membrane (Hydraguard)
Apply final coat of membrane (Hydraguard)
Allow curing in accordance with manufacturers specification 24-48 hours min
Apply top coat (polyguard) in accordance with manufacturers specifications.
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats.
Ensure all work is completed as per ITP

Area barricaded off to allow no access to roofs with signs posted/ visible to include date of application
Ensure "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust.
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer - have signed by Aland - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Primer (Polyprime or Hydrapoxy)
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations (PVC prime & Metal prime)
All corners have polyurethane bond breaker (hydraflex) installed with min 12mm radios
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat
Apply first coat of membrane (Hydraguard)
Apply final coat of membrane (Hydraguard)
Allow curing in accordance with manufacturers specification 24-48 hours min
Apply top coat (polyguard) in accordance with manufacturers specifications.
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument - a total dry film thickness of 1.2mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats.

Planter Boxes
Area barricaded off to allow no access to roofs with signs posted/ visible to include date of application
Ensure "No access waterproofing work in progress"
Membrane system and methodology checked off against ALAND standard details and MSDS and guidelines
Surface Preparation as per Application Guide
Substrate clean, dry and free from dust
Ensure substrate is structurally sound and ready to receive membrane
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to primer - have signed by Aland - Do not proceed if above has not been signed off
Apply Primer (Hydrapoxy)
Ensure all floor wastes and pipes have been primed in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations
All corners have polyurethane bond breaker (hydraflex) installed with min 12mm radios
Ensure Humidity, temperature and moisture are in accordance with manufacturer's recommendations prior to first coat (PVC prime & Metal prime)
Apply first coat of membrane (Hydraguard AR100)
Apply final coat of membrane (Hydraguard AR100)
Allow curing in accordance with manufacturers specification 24-48 hours min
Carry out dry film thickness test using Positector coating thickness inspection instrument - a total dry film thickness of 12mm (1200 microns) in two finished coats
Ensure all work is completed as per ITP
